command: try { $key=$env:GREYNOISE_API_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key)){ throw 'Missing GREYNOISE_API_KEY'; }; $ip='1.1.1.1'; $uri="https://api.greynoise.io/v2/noise/context/$ip"; $resp=Invoke-RestMethod -Method Get -Uri $uri -Headers @{key=$key; Accept='application/json'} -TimeoutSec 25 -ErrorAction Stop; $resp | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\ti_t1597.log" -Value ("[GreyNoise] " + $_.Exception.Message) }
explanation: Fetches enterprise GreyNoise noise context for an IP, a subscription-only closed-source dataset that profiles scanning behavior. Uses API key header and outputs JSON.
rationale_steps: Read API key from environment and validate presence.
Target a single IP to minimize operational noise.
Set Accept to JSON and use a conservative timeout.
Serialize output and log errors without exposing secrets.
